description: Use verb-noun format for all story elements (epic names, feature names, story titles)

examples.description: Use verb-noun format for epic names
content: Manage Orders, Create Character, Process Payment

examples.description: Use verb-noun format for feature names
content: Place Order, Validate Payment, Save Character

examples.description: Use verb-noun format for story titles
content: Customer places order, System validates payment, User saves character

examples.description: Use verb-noun format for scenario sentences
content: User submits form, System processes request

examples.description: Use base verb forms (infinitive/imperative), not third-person singular
content: Select Multiple Tokens, Group Minions Into Mob, Display Confirmation, Add Tokens To Mob, Remove Tokens From Mob

examples.description: Don't use noun-only or capability-based names
content: Order Management, Payment Processing, Character System

examples.description: Don't mix verb-noun with other formats
content: Order Management and Place Order (mixed format)

examples.description: Don't use third-person singular verb forms (selects, groups, displays, adds, removes)
content: Selects Multiple Tokens, Groups Minions Into Mob, Displays Confirmation, Adds Tokens To Mob, Removes Tokens From Mob
